oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Received from Joseph B. Peyton at the Gallatin Assistant Quartermaster's Office $23.00 for a bay horse
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; War and use of animals; Horses
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page form. It includes a description of the horse, which was sold in accordance with orders at public auction on April 16, 1864. The horse, No. 210, is 16 hands high, age 9, and has bay coloring.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Historical Society Civil War Collection, 1860-1982
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Army horses sold at auction were branded on the left shoulder with the letters "I. C." (perhaps "inspected and condemned") above "U. S."
